reviews.review_msg: Melissa is a great prof as she cares a lot of her students. There are a lot of reading than i expected. I feel I might enjoy to work with her more in a non-classroom setting without the pressure of writing papers and work on group projects. I can imagine myself to have a deep and thoughtful discussion with her regarding a HR topic.

Instructions are not clear, which is spun as "grad school being more challenging" & other student gaslighting.

12-20 hrs/week group work or make-work projects that don't prepare you for the final exam.

The GDBA is a second-class citizen at Beedie. If your employer is footing the bill, carry on, but don't pay good money for this. Good luck!

I felt like the course material was exceedingly easy, so they ramp up the difficulty by just being picky graders, looking for highly specific things and punishing harshly if you miss them. So taking the course is an exercise in mind-reading what the professor wants. Overall, I found the course's artificial difficulty demotivating.

Melissa is a very hardworking person, and I can tell she is very passionate about HR and Organizational Behaviour. The course contents are easy, but being able to apply those contents to assignments and case studies are challenging. However, she gives great feedbacks and goes above and beyond to ensure her students succeed in her classes!
